qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes the challenge of identifying high-value users in highly heterogeneous freemium user bases.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Making Digital Freemium Business Models a Success: Predicting Customers' Lifetime Value via Initial Purchase Information
qualitative_analysis.quote: Several online blogs have recently reported a steep increase in user acquisition costs. For example, Hochman (2015) mentions an average CPC (cost per click) increase from $0.38 in 2005 to $0.92 in 2013 (i.e., an average annual increase of 11.7%)
qualitative_analysis.justification: Highlights the escalating cost challenge of customer acquisition in digital consumer markets.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Understanding the influence of absorptive capacity and ambidexterity on the process of business model change – the case of on-premise and cloud-computing software
qualitative_analysis.quote: Disruptive innovations typically have this effect because they fundamentally change the rules of competition in established markets, often leading to the incumbents' failure as they react too late or falteringly. Disruptive innovations challenge a firm's dominant logic as embedded in established business models
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes how disruptive innovations challenge incumbent firms' ability to adapt their business models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Understanding the influence of absorptive capacity and ambidexterity on the process of business model change – the case of on-premise and cloud-computing software
qualitative_analysis.quote: Moving from product-oriented to service-oriented business models requires a change of mindset and creates massive organisational integration efforts. It really is a challenge to get our existing partner network cloud-ready
qualitative_analysis.justification: Highlights the organizational transformation and partner adaptation challenges in transitioning to service models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
qualitative_analysis.quote: Managing ecosystem transition and preventing collapse - changes in one entity trigger responses in others. customers and partners show uncertainties. partners fear the termination of the partnership
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes the interconnected challenges of managing customer and partner relationships during transitions.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
qualitative_analysis.quote: Constraining the scale of change within the organization might cause the collapse of the ecosystem, which in turn threatens the survival of the business itself
qualitative_analysis.justification: Highlights the systemic risk of ecosystem collapse during business model transitions.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business models and opportunity creation: How IT entrepreneurs create and develop business models under uncertainty
qualitative_analysis.quote: How can entrepreneurs develop business models for markets in which the technology is constantly changing – or create business models for markets that do not exist? There were so many open questions related to the technology and how it would develop in the future
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes the uncertainty challenges of developing business models for non-existent or rapidly evolving markets.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business models and opportunity creation: How IT entrepreneurs create and develop business models under uncertainty
qualitative_analysis.quote: It was a very challenging time to do any business... continually looking for successful pilot projects, credible partners, and funding
qualitative_analysis.justification: Highlights the resource acquisition and partnership challenges faced by startups in uncertain markets.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Revenue models, in-app purchase, and the app performance: Evidence from Apple's App Store and Google Play
qualitative_analysis.quote: the choice of the revenue model is perceived as one of the most difficult and crucially important decisions by app developers. many developers struggle with the choice of the appropriate revenue model for their apps as the mobile app market has become very competitive
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes the strategic complexity of revenue model selection in competitive mobile markets.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Commercialization of Composite Software Resulting from Collaborative Research
qualitative_analysis.quote: Issues to be targeted in this context are the shift from a project to a setting with commercial aims, and the development of inter-company business models suitable for composite software products. individual partners often rate the results of collaborative projects, in particular the commercialisation and the direct use of their results and related monetary returns, as less successful
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes the transition challenges from collaborative research to commercial business models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Adjusting software revenue and pricing strategies in the era of cloud computing
qualitative_analysis.quote: SaaS providers may incur significant operating costs due to the fact that they have to invest in service and system capacity in order to guarantee availability of the service. security threats were the most dominating factor in risk perception
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes infrastructure investment requirements and security concerns in cloud-based models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Adjusting software revenue and pricing strategies in the era of cloud computing
qualitative_analysis.quote: there are knowledge interdependencies between SaaS providers and their customers, and that these create challenges in combining IT services. transaction costs tended to lead to information asymmetry, possibly resulting in contractual incompleteness and opportunism
qualitative_analysis.justification: Highlights integration complexity and transaction cost challenges in B2B SaaS relationships.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing business models for cloud platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: At the start of our study, Alpha was struggling with its PaaS solution for the following reasons...development costs were higher than planned, and Alpha failed to meet the planned sales figures. when the platform reaches a stage in which it can be opened to customers, there are usually no, or only a few, applications and components available
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes the chicken-and-egg problem and financial challenges in launching platform business models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing business models for cloud platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: Migrating/moving already existing applications to PaaS does not provide obvious added value to customers but requires much development effort. PaaS is very different from selling SaaS. A technology sale is very different kind of sale
qualitative_analysis.justification: Highlights value proposition and sales model challenges in platform-as-a-service business models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business Models for Cloud Computing: Experiences from Developing Modeling & Simulation as a Service Applications in Industry
qualitative_analysis.quote: Developing this business model is complex and challenging due to a number of factors: The business venture is based on close partnership and collaboration amongst a number of key stakeholders. The multi-stakeholder nature of the CSSP offering adds complexity. The stakeholders have varying business requirements for pricing, product delivery, payment methods
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes multi-stakeholder coordination and diverse requirement challenges in platform ecosystems.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Study on a Decentralized SaaS Business Model
qualitative_analysis.quote: when a growing mid-size provider broadening its business to global market, it may suffer from many investment and management issues. when a provider suffers from a server emergency, such as the incident happened in Amazon AWS, or a security attack, such as DDoS, the whole chain of its market will face a serious problem, which is commonly known as the single-point-of-failure problem
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes infrastructure reliability and scalability challenges in global SaaS deployments.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
qualitative_analysis.quote: not all customers are willing to rent the software through the public cloud, due to security concerns or a low readiness for new technologies. We do not have low switching costs because the amount of project work needed to get the system to work is so great
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes customer adoption barriers related to security concerns and implementation complexity.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Service-Centric Business Model in Cloud Environment
qualitative_analysis.quote: The BM evolution mechanism and the new BM conceptualization in cloud are still 'murky'. There are unilateral understandings on BM evolution in cloud environment by treating cloud computing as a new business model or an IT technology solution. The conceptualization of BM is not consensus
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes the conceptual confusion and lack of consensus in cloud business model frameworks.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing Viable Multi-sided Data Platforms: The Case of Context-Aware Mobile Travel Applications
qualitative_analysis.quote: Designing these platforms is challenging as they should serve multiple user groups at the same time. A core issue is then who should subsidize the platform. Sharing context information generated by a mobile application with other app developers risks violating user privacy
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes multi-sided market challenges including subsidy decisions and privacy concerns in data platforms.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Economic and business perspectives on smartphones as multi-sided platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: A key characteristic of every multi-sided platform is that at the starting point it faces a chicken-and-egg problem: in a platform with two customer types, Type-I customers do not want to commit to participating in the platform until they see enough commitment on the part of Type-II customers
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes the classic chicken-and-egg coordination challenge in multi-sided platform business models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Crushing Candy: The Free-to-Play Game in Its Connective Commodity Form
qualitative_analysis.quote: The lower barrier to market entry for app development also made the app economy a highly competitive market and the discoverability of new apps has become a significant challenge. A mere 3% of its player network of over 300+ million consisted of payers
qualitative_analysis.justification: Highlights discovery and conversion challenges in the competitive mobile gaming market.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Effects of Freemium Strategy in the Mobile App Market: An Empirical Study of Google Play
qualitative_analysis.quote: Android app market presents such a challenge not only because there are now close to 1.3 million apps but also because every month some 15,000 new apps are introduced. the free version may cannibalize the sales of the paid version, leading to lower overall revenue and profit
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes market saturation and cannibalization challenges in mobile app freemium models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Network Externalities, Incumbent's Competitive Advantage and the Degree of Openness of Software Start-Ups
qualitative_analysis.quote: the inability of potential OS users to benefit from network externalities is a major obstacle for the development of a lively demand for OS solutions. computer users are often scared by potential incompatibility between OS and proprietary standards
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes network effect limitations and compatibility concerns facing open source startups.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
qualitative_analysis.quote: The first challenge stems from clients' expectations for better service quality... The second challenge comes from the diversity of SaaS clients... The third challenge resides in clients' varied usage of software services
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes multiple challenges including quality expectations, customer diversity, and usage pattern variability.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Clarifying the Value Elements of Business Models for Disturbance Management in Supply Chains
qualitative_analysis.quote: The Competition in this kind of SaaS based service solutions was found to be rather low, although companies' own ERP systems and other applications are competing with the new solution
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes competitive challenges from existing enterprise systems in B2B SaaS markets.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: The Impact of Open Source Software Commercialization on Firm Value
qualitative_analysis.quote: relying solely on an open business model remains too risky in competitive markets. the main challenge of reaping the benefits from it
qualitative_analysis.justification: Highlights the challenge of value capture and the need for hybrid approaches in open source commercialization.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: The relationship between Open Innovation and Strategy: data-driven analysis of the Mobile Value Services Industry
qualitative_analysis.quote: designing an open business model. achieving competitive advantage through value capture. integration of the open business model with the preexisting 'closed' models. wrong partner selection. loss of control over knowledge and core resources
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes multiple challenges in implementing open innovation including control, integration, and partnership issues.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Open-Source Software Entrepreneurial Business Modelling
qualitative_analysis.quote: most users of the OSS_EBM framework still report difficulties in understanding how their business ideas can generate monetary results with open-source software
qualitative_analysis.justification: Highlights the fundamental challenge of monetization in open source business models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Towards a better Understanding of the Dynamics of Platform as a Service Business Models
qualitative_analysis.quote: even though the classification schema has been evaluated in 24 case studies, the developed qualitative system dynamics model has been evaluated only in two proof of concept studies. 4CaaSt needs to ensure platform improvements. 4CaaSt should definitely improve its value proposition to application customers
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes value proposition and platform improvement challenges in PaaS business models.
